meanings.definition: Proteins that package and order the DNA into structural units called nucleosomes.
meanings.sent1: Histones play a crucial role in organizing DNA into nucleosomes.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how histones help structure DNA in cells.
meanings.sent3: The histones in the cell nucleus are like tiny DNA organizers.
meanings.sent4: The histones act as the architects of the DNA building blocks.
meanings.sent5: Imagine histones as the neat-freaks of the DNA world, tidying up every genetic strand.

meanings.definition: A type of protein found in the cell nucleus that helps organize DNA.
meanings.sent1: The histones assist in the organization of DNA within the nucleus.
meanings.sent2: Cells contain histones that aid in DNA organization.
meanings.sent3: The histones in the nucleus are like DNA's personal organizers.
meanings.sent4: Histones are the DNA arrangers in the cell's command center.
meanings.sent5: Visualize histones as the DNA's interior decorators, arranging genetic material with precision.
